Quaternions

mvdatasets.geometry.quaternions.angular_distance(q1, q2)

compute row-wise angular distance between two batches of quaternions

Parameters:

  • q1 (torch.tensor) – (N, 4) batch of quaternions

  • q2 (torch.tensor) – (N, 4) batch of quaternions

Output:

theta (torch.tensor): (N,) batch of angular distances

mvdatasets.geometry.quaternions.make_quaternion_deg(deg_x, deg_y, deg_z, dtype=torch.float32, device='cpu')
mvdatasets.geometry.quaternions.make_quaternion_rad(rad_x, rad_y, rad_z, dtype=torch.float32, device='cpu')
mvdatasets.geometry.quaternions.quat_invert(q)

Inverts a batch of quaternions q. q: (N, 4) batch of quaternions Returns: (N, 4) batch of inverted quaternion

mvdatasets.geometry.quaternions.quat_multiply(a: tensor, b: tensor) → tensor
mvdatasets.geometry.quaternions.quats_to_rots(quats: tensor | ndarray) → tensor | ndarray
mvdatasets.geometry.quaternions.rots_to_quats(rots: tensor) → tensor

Convert rotations given as rotation matrices to quaternions.

Parameters:

matrix – Rotation matrices as tensor of shape (…, 3, 3).

Returns:

quaternions with real part first, as tensor of shape (…, 4).
